intro: Microcoelia globulosa, commonly known as the globular microcoelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbel-like inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its small, white flowers bloom in late spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The species is known for its compact, globular shape, which gives it its common name.
